Description: Mould-made female draped figure in plaster (?). Fragment of lower body of draped figurine; right knee bent forward; knot tied in drape in front and falling below waist; part of buttocks exposed.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Redpath Museum, Montreal. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Plaster figures are rarely preserved. Roman plaster figures from Oxyrhynchus and Alexandria exist (Bailey 2008, GR 1897,1026.1; Adriani 1940, pl. lxxii:1–2). The majority of plaster figure fragments found at Naukratis are architectural fragments of trial examples of Egyptian sculptors. Adriani, A. 1940, Municipalité d’Alexandrie, Annuaire du musée Gréco-Romain, Volume II (1935-1939), Alexandria.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.691) (Phase 3)
